intro: Deverra denudata, commonly known as the naked devil's ivy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Deverra denudata is often grown as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
